meanings.sent1: Her omniscience amazed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The professor's omniscience in history was unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The detective's omniscience made solving the case look easy.
meanings.sent4: His omniscience was like a beacon of light in the darkness of ignorance.
meanings.sent5: The omniscience of the wise owl was legendary in the forest.

meanings.definition: The quality of having unlimited knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The book's author wrote with great omniscience on the subject.
meanings.sent2: In the world of science fiction, characters often possess omniscience.
meanings.sent3: The robot's omniscience led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a spark of omniscience, as if she knew all the secrets of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's omniscience was both a blessing and a curse in his quest for truth.
